website_summaries.verdict: Balance is an issue with this fly reel, though its drag adjustment works smoothly and holds well.
pros: Nicely constructed, with easily adjustable drag
Users like its looks, feel, and weight
Attaches to most fly rods without a problem
cons: Line clearance isn’t very good, rubbing against the side of the reel
Included spool is off balance and can come loose easily
Squeaks and squeals out of the box, requiring lubricant

customer_reviews.title: I gave it 3 stars because it had been a good reel until now
customer_reviews.text: UPDATE: MAXCATCH stands by their product! They replaced the reel. Since I have several of their products I will continue buying their product with confidence! I ordered it January 2017 and in November 2017 the drag system has failed. The past couple of times while out fishing I'm stripping line and the reel starts free-spooling creating a bird's nest. I had to remove the reel, untangle the line and reel it back while standing mid-current. I gave it 3 stars since because it had been a good reel until now.
customer_reviews.author: XP User

customer_reviews.title: Nice reel, great price.
customer_reviews.text: Nice compact reel. Just a tad bit wider than some others I have seen in this line weight size. Built with lots of ventilation so line will dry well. The break and drag system if fairly smooth, there is a little pulsing. Very nice reel for its price. I wanted small and light, that is what it is, as well as built well. I should add the spool removal system is easy to use. I had bought another small reel and it was a compression system. Had to pull so hard I was afraid I would bend the spool. This one has a switch, move it, spool comes off.
customer_reviews.author: Larry

customer_reviews.title: Nice reel for holding my 4 wt line but there ...
customer_reviews.text: Nice reel for holding my 4 wt line but there is very little play between too tight of drag and to loose. but at this price I guess I can live with it and for a light rod like this I won't be using the drag- I just don't like the spool to let line out too freely and to have to pull too hard to get it out with not much in between.
customer_reviews.author: Robin C.

customer_reviews.title: As expected.
customer_reviews.text: This is a molded reel. It is not as clean as the one in the picture of it. The one pictured is CNC not molded. It took a while to remove the flashing to make it look better. I have the 3/4 wt so all I was looking for was something to store the line with a drag if ever needed, and this fills the bill nicely.
customer_reviews.author: Edward Wick

customer_reviews.title: Surprisingly smooth
customer_reviews.text: I bought a eagle claw 3wt rod to play around with in ponds, this blows away all expectations for the price. I recommend to any beginner or anyone at an intermideate range. I got on the reel a few times and easily reeled in small bass and blue gill. Never had the fly line get caught in the reel like many other cheap options.
customer_reviews.author: josh

customer_reviews.title: Would like to know if the line on the reel is eco or generic line
customer_reviews.text: I like the reel. It came preloaded with backing and line but you will want to change the leader or re-tie the leader butt. It was very poorly tied. Factory worker Overseas probably got tired. The fly line supposed to be a floating line but it turns into an intermediate line after a few times out. Spend and extra 20 bucks and buy some scientific angler air cell or something. Overall a good product. It's still holding up. I've caught bass, catfish and big carp on it. Something about a fly; you never know what's going to take it as everything loves nymphs and flies
customer_reviews.author: Al K.

customer_reviews.title: Fantastic price for a quality reel!
customer_reviews.text: Great reel at a better price! I caught some 26"-34" catfish, as well as some smaller rainbows. Drag works fine and is easily adjustable, depending upon the size of the fish, and it is relatively easy to adjust on the fly. I put about 100 yards of backing and 10 feet of 5-weight line, and I still have plenty of room for leaders and tippet. It is a fine reel and Maxcatch's customer service is also great!
customer_reviews.author: AZHawg

customer_reviews.title: Reel was not inspected and tested before delivery.
customer_reviews.text: This reel took 1 day to deliver and that was nice but right out of the box I started to feel it and it was catching and warped feeling. Upon further inspection I noticed it was very loose and could not be tightened. I tried to take off the screw but couldn't. I put it back in the Chinese box it was packed in and will buy a different product.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Reel has some drawbacks
customer_reviews.text: I ordered a 5/6 W and received a 3/4 W reel, the biggest disappointment of this reel was when I striped line off of the reel the drag changes all by itself so you are always readjusting the drag throughout the day. Also each click of the drag changes the friction tremendously. I would like to have a bigger span of drag on the reel. But, the price is right and I will give this reel to my grandson and purchase something else.
customer_reviews.author: JERSEYDEVIL

customer_reviews.title: Good price and great value.
customer_reviews.text: The reel works well and is a good value. The drag works well and seems pretty uniform in its operation. The only challenge I have with the reel is there is absolutely no resistance on the spool when reeling. This causes a strange situation when casting where the reel free spoils and actually takes in slack. It is something I have learned to keep tension on the extra line or touch the spool with my hand when casting to prevent the free spool forward. For the price this is something I can deal with, but the old click type reels solve this issue with a gear on the spool to always keep a small amount of tension on it.
customer_reviews.author: Dennis J. Kaufman

customer_reviews.title: Not bad for a $20 reel
customer_reviews.text: Appears to be CNC machined, I like the finish, and the drag functions as it should. Large arbor gives you plenty of capacity for backing and 3 or 4wt fly line. Paired mine up with an Eagle Claw Featherlight 6'6", 2-pc rod and 4wt line. Should work great on small ponds going after bluegills and smaller bass.
customer_reviews.author: Shrekoutdoors

customer_reviews.title: You get what you pay for
customer_reviews.text: Having previously purchased a Maxcatch rod, I was expecting more from this reel. The spool does not spin evenly on reel and looks like it has been dropped. The reel also has a few casting defects. I don't think they will effect the use. If this was going to be more than a backup to my other setups, I would return it, but wanted to let people know not to expect a lot from this reel. Next time I will get an Echo Base for a few dollars more.
customer_reviews.author: David Sharp

customer_reviews.title: Not too bad
customer_reviews.text: This is my second one great for the price. The casting is a little rough but I finished it off with a little file and some sand paper. I also have an avid reel and it’s really nice they make some good stuff for the money
customer_reviews.author: Justin

customer_reviews.title: Very small profile
customer_reviews.text: I really like this reel. I bought it to replace my Pflueger so it would'nt get damaged. Actually bought two, one for my 3wt and one for my 5wt. So far I am very pleased with the quality and operation of this reel. Would definitely buy it again.
customer_reviews.author: Washington Rain Camper

customer_reviews.title: Four Stars
customer_reviews.text: I bought this reel and when I received it the spool fit rather loosely so that my line would slip between the spool and the housing for the spool i let maxcatch know and they sent me a new one. the new one doesn't have that problem and is a good reel for the price.
customer_reviews.author: Zach

customer_reviews.title: Excellent value
customer_reviews.text: Bought 2 more for my 4’2” and 6’ small stream rods. Rarely use drag but these reel has a good chatter-free and smooth drag. I like the width of this large arbor reel. Very forgiving on line retrieval. I don’t need backing when using 100’ fly-line. Would recommend to friends.
customer_reviews.author: J. Jansen

customer_reviews.title: Grinding noise
customer_reviews.text: Bent spool spindle possibly. I just took this out for the first time. The spool does not spin freely it’s making a grinding noise as if it’s hitting something internally. Seems like it would be a nice reel otherwise.
customer_reviews.author: Caleb Martin

customer_reviews.title: A PSA
customer_reviews.text: I just wanted to leave a PSA because I can’t reply to questions I’ve asked on the product... you get what you pay for obviously it isn’t great but it’s not terrible either I asked a question about the line weight, essentially “is the 7/8 preloaded reel a 7 or 8 weight specifically?” My two answers were “It’s not preloaded” And “I don’t know I ordered the 2/3” I have never been more dumbfounded... yes the PRELOADED reel comes PRELOADED And if you don’t know the answer to a question... don’t answer Unreal
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Inexpensive but great for the price
customer_reviews.text: Not an expensive reel but it works great for a beginner. I gave it as a gift and then lost the spool to my sage reel so I threw it on my rod for a weekend trip and I loved it. The drag is pretty good and it looks clean but the paint does scratch easy
customer_reviews.author: blaked386

customer_reviews.title: Blown Away
customer_reviews.text: For such a cheap reel and line combo, this thing performs great. I'd compare it to my $100 5wt Ross reel that is my favorite. The line is alright, but for the price you can't beat it. The retrieve on the reel is smooth and the drag is pretty good. The material is not the highest quality but for my 3wt rod, that is all I need. GREAT PRODUCT!
customer_reviews.author: AddisonT.

customer_reviews.title: I returned it
customer_reviews.text: Don’t like to bash a product too hard but this is not a functional drag. It can hold your line if you hand fight all of your fish. But spool is not perfectly machined and has a warp to it. Meaning it grinds through half of the rotation.
customer_reviews.author: Matt L

customer_reviews.title: Love this reel
customer_reviews.text: Love this reel. Bought for my first 8WT to catch pike and muskie. I have now caught multiple 30" plus fish and the drag system works like a charm. I will be looking to try out other reels made by MAXCATCH and review. Hopefully they are as good as this one!
customer_reviews.author: Joel S Davids

customer_reviews.title: Great reel for the price. It's close the the same quality as my much more expensive Cabela reel.
customer_reviews.text: I ordered the reel from my wife's Amazon account. I caught a 19" Rainbow Trout the first time I used the new reel. Not sure if it was the reel or my fly fishing expertise. LOL. Couldn't get my phone out of the pouch to take a picture. I released the fish and I almost caught it again in the the same hole about a week later. I'm thinking about buying the same reel again for one of my other fly rods. Very nice reel at a very nice price!
customer_reviews.author: Joan Feneley

customer_reviews.title: It is what you paid for...
customer_reviews.text: No magic bullets here. If you need a reel to hold line, has an adjustable drag and seems like it will hold-up, this is totally worth $18 bucks. I wish the arbor was larger, it's smallish since it's a 3-4wt. The drag is adjustable, but I wouldn't call it finely tuned. Again, if you know how to use your hands, I've successfully fished with reels that no drag.
customer_reviews.author: William Zobrist

customer_reviews.title: Great value
customer_reviews.text: This is a 3WT reel and works very well have used 5-6 times and all good. Drag adjustment is fine and catches fish well.
customer_reviews.author: Dano

customer_reviews.title: Quality and affordable
customer_reviews.text: Fly fishing isn't cheap but this reel will save you $. Great finish, great feel, excellent drag. Great buy!
customer_reviews.author: CO gal

customer_reviews.title: Great fly rod
customer_reviews.text: Very nice fly reel for the $$$. Fast shipping too. A+ Thank you
customer_reviews.author: rich

customer_reviews.title: I like this reel a lot.
customer_reviews.text: I like the size and weight of the reel. Just what I need for small streams in my area. The quality seems to be great.

customer_reviews.title: Unreal cheap value
customer_reviews.text: Knowing Maxcatch and their good quality products(I have several), I hope this little 3/4wt bugger holds up for a day or two of nymphing, I bought two just in case..lol
customer_reviews.author: Scott

customer_reviews.title: Great Fly Reel 👍
customer_reviews.text: This is a great reel for the price! For those of you who can’t afford a $100. + reel this will fill The bill. And it look great!
customer_reviews.author: CJLevesque

customer_reviews.title: very slick on the retrieve
customer_reviews.text: the drag goes from a "little to a lot" quickly other wise for the minimal amount of money rather serviceable and that is the only reason for a 4 and not a 5
customer_reviews.author: stevan j anselmi

customer_reviews.title: Nice reel
customer_reviews.text: Sharp looking reel. But most importantly it’s a well made reel. I purchased a 2wt fly rod and needed a reel for it. I bought a 1-2wt reel but it was too small. This 3wt was a perfect fit. Nice drag on this too. Overall very happy.
customer_reviews.author: Richard Maliszewski

customer_reviews.title: Unforeseen event's with the arrival of Fly Fishing Reel
customer_reviews.text: Due to circumstances beyond their control, the product was received after a very long and anticipated wait. My husband is very happy with the reel. He said it is very clean, the drag is totally awesome, and it is more than he expected! The Maxcatch Fishing Team was very professional and accommodating to resolve the delays, and they did everything in their ability to get this item delivered. Many thanks!
customer_reviews.author: Kay Hurtado

customer_reviews.title: Great Reel For the Money
customer_reviews.text: This reel is a great reel for my euro nymphing rig. It's a little on the heavy side, which balances out my euro rod very nicely. I don't do really any casting with it, so can't speak to that aspect, but overall it's a great reel for the money. It's also a really cool pattern.
customer_reviews.author: Smith

customer_reviews.title: Great reel
customer_reviews.text: Great reel. Caught 15 Inch rainbows to 22 inch land locked salmon with ease
customer_reviews.author: Tyler S.

customer_reviews.title: Heavy reel
customer_reviews.text: Just okay quality reel. It is very heavy for a 3/4wt reel. The weight balances better on a 5wt rod, but then you lose a lot of capacity. If you don't care about that kind of thing and are just looking for a cheap line holder for your rod, go for it.
customer_reviews.author: Sam Anich

customer_reviews.title: Looks great
customer_reviews.text: Very nice looking. There is something wrong with the mechanics of the reel. It backlashes and doings and I can’t get it to stop
customer_reviews.author: Kimberly Bowser

customer_reviews.title: Great for the price.
customer_reviews.text: The paint started wearing away pretty quick but I’m rough with my stuff.
customer_reviews.author: Chief

customer_reviews.title: Not pre-loaded
customer_reviews.text: Ad and box says: "Pre-loaded with fly line, backing, and leader for your convenience". NOT TRUE. NOT PRE-LOADED! Rip off.
customer_reviews.author: Thomas Epich

customer_reviews.title: drag seems good enough, but if anyone reading this is like ...
customer_reviews.text: surprise!!!! worth more than it costs,the finish is a little chinsey but so is the price, drag seems good enough, but if anyone reading this is like me using the 5w (or smaller) to catch trout in smaller streams, the drag wont ever see any action, great reel for the price, good job maxcatch
customer_reviews.author: jody mcquay

customer_reviews.title: Made it right
customer_reviews.text: When I first received reel was displeased, tipper was wound up in gear,and when took apart couldn't get reel to work correctly.sent it back per amazon(very easy ,ups and print label) got New reel 3 days later .works great! Looking to purchase a saltwater combo from Maxcatch.highly recommended
customer_reviews.author: cliff nye

customer_reviews.title: Garbage. The spool is so wobbly on the reel ...
customer_reviews.text: Garbage. The spool is so wobbly on the reel that it will become so misaligned that the reel will stop working. The finish also was already flaking off when I took it out of the box. Save yourself a head ache and spend just a little more for a better reel. This one wont even make it out of the garage.
customer_reviews.author: John

customer_reviews.title: It is a good bang for your buck
customer_reviews.text: I like how smooth it was for the cost and the materials are right for the price
customer_reviews.author: Alberta Cerino

customer_reviews.title: I’ll buy more
customer_reviews.text: For this price this reel is perfect all knots where solid. My only complaint is it was scratched up a bit when I got it. If this is this good I’m excited to try more of their products I’d compare to an Orvis reel as far as functionality looks aren’t there yet but still a good looking reel.
customer_reviews.author: edward

customer_reviews.title: Good value
customer_reviews.text: Good reel , for a little piece of sand in the spool Though and that caused a disruption . Took it apart and cleaned/lubed works great once again . Good value and looks awesome
customer_reviews.author: CoachZack

customer_reviews.title: Great for the cost
customer_reviews.text: For the price its great. Drag is smooth enough and I havent had any issues.
customer_reviews.author: Kathryn Throckmorton

customer_reviews.title: Great reel.
customer_reviews.text: Well I fished a few months with this reel and for the money I think it's fantastic. I also bought a Maxcatch rod to go with it and the 5wt line is a great combo.
customer_reviews.author: TAM

customer_reviews.title: Great Value
customer_reviews.text: So far so good. It's a great value reel. It works as expected.
customer_reviews.author: JimE Walker

customer_reviews.title: Nice deal all round
customer_reviews.text: Nice looking ,solid ratchet.and fits well for use ,and of course the price was really good . I need to try it but will not be using it for a a little while yet .
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer.    Roger.  B

customer_reviews.title: This is a well balanced very nice reel!
customer_reviews.text: The reel is light and solid, comparable to my very expensive reels. The price is excellent!
customer_reviews.author: rita martinez

customer_reviews.title: Very new to fly fishing and this was a great price to start out
customer_reviews.text: Very new to fly fishing and this was a great price to start out. Looks good and feels good. If you are starting out and don't want to break the bank this is the perfect start. Everything i ever read about starting out they always said the reel is just to hold your line and this does it very well.
customer_reviews.author: DJ Lien

customer_reviews.title: Poor quality. Not as pictured.
customer_reviews.text: Poor quality. Not as pictured. Barely able to spin reel. Arbor grinds and catches. Not usable. Requested replacement. Will update once I receive a new reel if applicable.
customer_reviews.author: JP

customer_reviews.title: Not a bad product at all
customer_reviews.text: Seems to do it’s job. Not a bad product at all!
customer_reviews.author: Aaron V

customer_reviews.title: Not Pre-Loaded like Advertised
customer_reviews.text: Purchased this one because it was described as pre-loaded. It is not. Looks and feels cheap too.
customer_reviews.author: Artist Randall Yarbrough

customer_reviews.title: Great if you are right handed and don’t need to change the retrieve
customer_reviews.text: This product has cheap plastic gear part. and I was unable to switch to Right hand retrieve because the gear was on on one side and the little ball bearing part fall out. Also there was no lubrication. The product would be great if the improved those things.
customer_reviews.author: Jill Nelson

customer_reviews.title: Super happy with this Reel.
customer_reviews.text: Why spend a ton of money when you can get just as good of a product for a quarter of the price?? I'm all about functionality, and this reel works great! Its sturdy, good weight, and the drag on it works just as good as my Orvis reel. Overall great buy.
customer_reviews.author: D

customer_reviews.title: Good value
customer_reviews.text: Light weight and pre wound with line. Line is the best quality, but great value.
customer_reviews.author: Mark

customer_reviews.title: Quality seems to be suspect
customer_reviews.text: Bought this reel end of summer 2018. I have used it10 times now. Last time out, the reel spindle started wobbling and I can’t use it. The screw on the back thru the drag knob doesn’t tighten anything. I had high hopes too. Dang.
customer_reviews.author: Arturo

customer_reviews.title: Poor drag setup
customer_reviews.text: The reel is OK but the drag doesn't stay set and is very quick to the touch.
customer_reviews.author: DARRYL hOUSE

customer_reviews.title: Good reel at a decent price
customer_reviews.text: I’m happy with the reel I purchased. It’s smooth and seems sturdy.
customer_reviews.author: Fred Larson

customer_reviews.title: Fish on
customer_reviews.text: Set up this sweet 3wt Euro Nymphing outfit for under 120.00 Maxcatch makes top quality fly fishing gear at a great price.
customer_reviews.author: Steve Boyan

customer_reviews.title: For a cast reel it isn't bad. Zero issues and I wanted it because it ...
customer_reviews.text: For a cast reel it isn't bad. Zero issues and I wanted it because it is cast, to balance out a 10' nymph rod, It has an excellent drag also.
customer_reviews.author: JasonCO

customer_reviews.title: Price
customer_reviews.text: Smooth, mechanically. Beautiful esthetically. Haven't got to use yet but I'm sure it works like any other fly reel.
customer_reviews.author: Al Rinon

customer_reviews.title: Nice reel.  Great price.
customer_reviews.text: Excellent reel for hooking the big one. Low price for a nice quality product.
customer_reviews.author: Elk Assassin

customer_reviews.title: Good Value
customer_reviews.text: Grabbed this as a backup reel for a Colorado Fly trip. Impressed with the quality and build. Would buy again if needed.
customer_reviews.author: Chase sellmeyer

customer_reviews.title: Great budget, beginner
customer_reviews.text: Great budget, beginner, or backup reel under $25. Drag is practically silet, holds 200ft of fly line & backing.
customer_reviews.author: Tom M.

customer_reviews.title: Very good reel
customer_reviews.text: Good size for an 8 wt. reel...very tight and drag seems to function very well
customer_reviews.author: Geo B

customer_reviews.title: For this price range its a great reel
customer_reviews.text: Got this for my 3wt CGR that will see some abuse and for the price Id say its a great deal! Very smooth drag and the finish is not bad at all.
customer_reviews.author: Branden

customer_reviews.title: The Reel thing
customer_reviews.text: Great replacement reel for one of our local club's educational Fly Casting outfits.
customer_reviews.author: Michael J Arnold

customer_reviews.title: 3/4 weight
customer_reviews.text: Very nice reel,highly recommend for any one on a budget. Very good drag.
customer_reviews.author: michael Doyle

customer_reviews.title: Ehhhh
customer_reviews.text: Not bad, but the cover rubs when reeling due to poor quality assembly
customer_reviews.author: daniel darr

customer_reviews.title: don't waste your money
customer_reviews.text: The real is nice and lite but that is the only positive quality. drag is horrible, It unravels to easy. sure it's cheap in price but so is the quality.
customer_reviews.author: steve

customer_reviews.title: Nice reel
customer_reviews.text: I have only used it once, bout feels like a quality piece of gear. Smooth and no rough or sharp edges. The pre-loaded line is good too.
customer_reviews.author: Dean

customer_reviews.title: Great reel crap line
customer_reviews.text: Reel is great line that comes with it isn’t so good
customer_reviews.author: Stephen Emerson

customer_reviews.title: It works
customer_reviews.text: It’s a plastic reel but if you’re looking for a basic piece of equipment, it works. Don’t listen to the lames that say you have to buy a $300 set to catch panfish or trout.
customer_reviews.author: Chris Fay

customer_reviews.title: Bought as a back up
customer_reviews.text: use it as a back up and works as it should.
customer_reviews.author: marco

customer_reviews.title: Maxcatch  large
customer_reviews.text: Good reel for the price. It is well made and looks good. The bearings run smooth but there is no lubrication on the main shaft from the factory. But the only problem that I see because there is no tension on the spoon. Nothing to hold it in place it turns on the rewind freely haven't had a problem with that yet. But sometimes it wants to unwind while casting. But it is a great reel for the price.
customer_reviews.author: Redneck22

customer_reviews.title: Poor Quality Control
customer_reviews.text: Just recieved my new eco 3/4 reel today. 1st impression poor quality control. It is in fact cast aluminium. However most of the flashing is still left on the ported holes and the inner rim of the housing. Also the handle is loose. If I use this reel I am pretty sure the flashing left on the reel will shread the fly line. I think i will return and get something different. If i could give it 0 stars I would.
customer_reviews.author: Jason Masters

customer_reviews.title: Good drag
customer_reviews.text: Husband was really pleased with this purchase said it had good drag. He is waiting for the fishing season to start so he can try it out.
customer_reviews.author: Edna

customer_reviews.title: Don’t do it.
customer_reviews.text: Have as a gift to my son. The first time he used it, it was broke. Don’t waste your money.
customer_reviews.author: leslieday

customer_reviews.title: eh
customer_reviews.text: Clearance is not good makes annoying rubbing sound and keeps it from being smooth when reeling in or stripping line
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Landing nicely.
customer_reviews.text: This was such an asset for my fly fishing rig.
customer_reviews.author: John C. Condray

customer_reviews.title: You get what you pay for
customer_reviews.text: Just OK quality But you get what you pay for
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Turd
customer_reviews.text: This thing is a turd. Used it twice and now the arbor is coming loose and it grinds the reel when it spins.
customer_reviews.author: Agustin Hinojosa

customer_reviews.title: Saltwater fly fishing
customer_reviews.text: Done well in the surf and inlets had two monster hits on closer minnows . couldn't ask for a better reel .
customer_reviews.author: Marcus Leonard

customer_reviews.title: Works great for the money.
customer_reviews.text: This reel works great for euro nymphing with a 3wt. Very easy to use and looks nice.
customer_reviews.author: customer

customer_reviews.title: For the money this reel qualifies. However, The ...
customer_reviews.text: For the money this reel qualifies. However, The lever that disconnects the spool from the reel came close to cutting my finger.
customer_reviews.author: John Thomas

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Well made. I see no reason to buy anything more expensive.
customer_reviews.author: Gary M.

customer_reviews.title: Seller shipped rapidly - big thumbs up in the covid era - unlike other sellers.
customer_reviews.text: The reel is what i've expected. I ordered a rod to pair it with, but that has yet to arrive.
customer_reviews.author: Christopher

customer_reviews.title: 👍
customer_reviews.text: Good reel, had to change handing but easy to do!!!!
customer_reviews.author: Aaron

customer_reviews.title: Great Backup Reel
customer_reviews.text: Works well, should have bought two. Only caution -- if you are gong to use this with a $500 rod, buy a $500 reel. Have landed many.many, panfish and a couple nice LM bass with reel.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Would not buy again
customer_reviews.text: Fell apart first time trying it. Will not stay together.
customer_reviews.author: Ron Nesler

customer_reviews.title: the spool has a tendency to detach from the reel ...
customer_reviews.text: the spool has a tendency to detach from the reel when I'm reeling in when I don't intend it to detach.
customer_reviews.author: Thomas

customer_reviews.title: No good
customer_reviews.text: Drag system broke on me first day I took out the reel.
customer_reviews.author: Rambo Solis

customer_reviews.title: Could be a bit smoother but for the price its ...
customer_reviews.text: Could be a bit smoother but for the price its unbeatable, caught plenty of fish on it since i got it.
customer_reviews.author: Brandon

customer_reviews.title: Product damaged
customer_reviews.text: Received my reel today opened it and there are scratches and chips everywhere
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Another good reel from maxcatch
customer_reviews.text: This is my second maxcatch reel, but won't be my last. They function really well. This particular reel is great on a featherweight or ultralite rod, it's light, and works perfectly. I've used it several times now to catch wild stream rainbow, Brown, and brook trout, as well as panfish and small bass.
customer_reviews.author: Steven Platek

customer_reviews.title: good for the price and to hold line but the ...
customer_reviews.text: good for the price and to hold line but the drag is not good especially if you accidentally put the reel in the water.
customer_reviews.author: Joel Vazquez

customer_reviews.title: Awesome reel
customer_reviews.text: This reel is amazing best bang for your buck drag works amazing definitely recommend to anyone
customer_reviews.author: jose seeley

customer_reviews.title: Flyreel looking Good
customer_reviews.text: Just came back from the 2016 iCast show where I looked and tried a lot of reels of the same quality. They all sold for a lot more even at wholesale pricing. No slop and the drag has a good range of adjustment. I was needing a fly reel that could be fished and could be use along with taken fish pictures. Preferring to have no name brands included in many of the photos this reel fits my needs. Now it's time to rig it up and go catch some fish and take some photos!
customer_reviews.author: Kimberly Lee

product_meta.title: M MAXIMUMCATCH Maxcatch ECO Large Arbor Fly Fishing Reel (3/4wt 5/6wt 7/8wt) and Pre-Loaded Fly Reel with Line Combo
feature_bullets: ONE-YEAR-WARRANTY – we as a 16 years fly reel factory, offer “No Hassle” warranty for all our reels. If you are not 100% satisfied with our reel, you can return it in any time.
OUTSTANDING VALUE – this reel incorporates all of the features of reels that costing much more money. We just wish to bring the experience of Fly fishing to more people
Strong and Durable All-aluminum construction, Large arbor design for rapid line retrieval
Rugged disc drag for putting serious pressure on the fish
One-way bearing for quick and easy left-to-right hand retrieval switch
